open_spaces_details.open_space_type: Allotments, community gardens and city farms

description: Construction of a detached two storey dwellinghouse including amenity space, boundary treatment, cycle storage and refuse storage provision
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with submitted drawings Location Plan ref. 16-024-01, received 07 November 2017; Site Plan as Existing ref. 16-024-02, received 07 November 2017; Plans as Existing ref. 16-024-03, received 07 November 2017; Plans as Existing ref. 16-024-04, received 07 November 2017; Elevations as Existing ref. 16-024-05, received 07 November 2017; Location Plan ref. 16-024-20B rev B, received 08 January 2018; Site Plan ref. 16-024-21B rev B, received 08 January 2018; Proposed Plans ref. 16-024-22B rev B, received 08 January 2018; Proposed Elevations ref. 16-024-23B rev B, received 08 January 2018; Proposed Elevations (Street Scene) ref. 16-024-24B rev B, received 08 January 2018.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Ensure refuse and recycling storage are provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E or F of Part 1 and Class A of Part 2 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 and/or any subsequent amendment, no alterations or extensions to the dwelling hereby approved, outbuildings within its curtilage or gate, fence, wall or other means of enclosure around its curtilage shall be erected without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of the residents of adjoining properties and the dwelling hereby approved and the visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 3.5, 7.4, 7.5, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016); and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| A minimum of two cycle parking spaces shall be provided and located in a secure undercover lockable compound, prior to the first occupation of the new dwelling permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Details including samples of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).
| The installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of under 0.03 g/kWh shall be completed prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first occupation and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.
| The existing dropped kerb along the site frontage to Green Lane shall be re-instated prior to the first occupation of the dwellings and maintained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interest of the visual amenity of the street scene and in the interest of highway safety in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 6.13 and 7.4 of the London Plan (2016).
| No development approved by this planning permission shall be commenced until:

a) A desktop study has been carried out which shall include the identification of previous site uses, potential contaminants that might reasonably be expected given those uses and other relevant information.  And using this information a diagrammatical representation (Conceptual Model) for the site of all potential contaminant sources, pathways and receptors has been produced.

b) A site investigation has been designed for the site using the information obtained from the desktop study and any diagrammatical representations (Conceptual Model).  This should be submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to that investigation being carried out on the site.  The investigation must be comprehensive enough to enable: - a risk assessment to be undertaken relating to groundwater and surface waters associated on and off the site that may be affected, and - refinement of the Conceptual Model, and - the development of a Method Statement detailing the remediation requirements.
c) The site investigation has been undertaken in accordance with details approved by the Local Planning Authority and a risk assessment has been undertaken.

d) A Method Statement detailing the remediation requirements, including measures to minimise the impact on ground and surface waters, using the information obtained from the Site Investigation has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority.  This should be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to that remediation being carried out on the site.
e) a Verification report providing evidence that the agreed remediation has been carried out and all off site disposal of material has been undertaken in accordance with the waste regulations.

Reason: To ensure that the proposed site investigations and remediation will not cause pollution of Controlled Waters, in accordance with policies 1.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 5.21 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| The roof light hereby approved within the front roof slope shall be installed as a conservation roof light only, and permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).

| The existing trees on or adjoining the site which are to be retained shall be protected and both the site and trees managed in accordance with the recommendations (including facilitative pruning specifications and supervision schedule) contained in the Arboricultural report TBDS_2FVLA_GL_AIA_001 by Treesense (18th October 2017). All tree protection measures shall be installed, carried out and retained throughout the period of the works, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  In any case, all works must adhere to BS5837: (2012) and BS3998: (2010).

Reason: To secure protection of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site and adjacent the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); and policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| Details in relation to a surface water strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, including:

a)	A detailed surface water strategy (benefits to include attenuation, water quality, bio-diversity and amenity) and detailed designs as per the approved flood risk assessment.  The detailed design should incorporate resistance and resilience measures as outlined in the flood risk assessment (the building must have been designed to allow water to pass through the property to avoid structural damage).

b)	Ground water investigation to inform for suitability of infiltration devices to attenuate into the sewer system (control peak run-off to a maximum of 3 times greenfield run-off for brownfield sites).
The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development hereby approved in accordance with policy 5.12 of the London Plan (2016).

| Details in relation to a maintenance plan and an evacuation plan in relation to the flood risk at the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation of the development.  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development hereby approved in accordance with policy 5.12 of the London Plan (2016).
